executive_summary: Over the five years to 2023, revenue for the Hydroponic Crop Farming industry has grown. While overall vegetable prices have increased over the five years, industry revenue has been limited by years with significant crop price drops. However, extreme weather conditions damaged many crops for fresh field farmers, so grocery stores and farmers' markets quickly turned to hydroponic farmers to meet their demand. In particular, drought throughout many parts of the United States over the past five years harmed agricultural industries across the board, presenting an opportunity for hydroponic crop farmers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Pandemic Aftermath Has Driven Vegetable Prices
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: In 2020 the COVID-19 pandemic disrupted markets and led to a shortage of most agricultural products. As farms returned to pre-pandemic production levels in the following years, fruit and vegetable prices surged. Hydroponic farms have been well-positioned with heightened crop prices to increase output and bring in greater revenue and profit. High market share concentration and competition from overseas have kept profit margins from growing substantially.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Hydroponics Provide Stability Amid Changing Weather Patterns
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: In recent history, agricultural industries have struggled to maintain consistent operations amid changing weather patterns brought on by climate change. Hydroponic farms are less impacted by droughts, floods and other severe weather events because they grow crops in controlled environments. As severe weather becomes more common, hydroponic farms stand to benefit from disrupted vegetable harvests.

While the US is a net exporter of most agricultural goods, it continues to be a net importer of fruits and vegetables. Hydroponic farms are less vulnerable to import competition than traditional farms because they are not affected by seasonal growth cycles. US vegetable imports have surged since the passage of the USMCA, which promoted increased trade between the US, Mexico and Canada.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Rising Interest Rates Have Constrained Farming Capacity
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: To combat high inflation, the Federal Reserve has been increasing interest rates recently. Interest rates had been particularly low in 2020 and 2021 amid the height of the COVID-19 pandemic. As the cost of borrowing has risen, it's become more difficult for hydroponic crop farmers to purchase machinery, land and other capital necessary to grow more produce, limiting revenue growth in 2023. Higher interest rates have also cooled the economy, reduced agricultural prices and further hampered revenue growth.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Vegetable Prices Continue to Grow, Pushing Industry Revenue Higher
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: While not as fast as during the post-pandemic period, the price of vegetables is expected to continue climbing over the next five years, pushing industry revenue higher. Profit is expected to stay low due to competition and high operating costs. In addition, falling per capita consumption of fruits and vegetables and a decline in the healthy eating index will contribute to falling profits.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Depreciation of the US Dollar Will Benefit Exporters
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the coming years, the value of the US dollar will depreciate relative to other major currencies. As the dollar depreciates, imports will become more expensive and exports will be less costly in overseas markets. While the US remains a net importer of fruits and vegetables, depreciation will give the industry a chance to grow its exports.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: New Entrants Are Expected to Enter the Market to Satisfy the Growing Industry Demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Industry enterprises are expected to climb over the next five years as new entrants seek to satisfy growing industry demand. New enterprises will likely be small companies as the industry is dominated by a few large operators.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Rising Incomes Will Likely Boost Demand for Farmers' Products
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite challenges related to high inflation, rising interest rates and recessionary fears, the economy is anticipated to hold up well during the outlook period. As inflation is expected to ultimately subside, the federal reserve will likely ultimately lower interest rates. Modest GDP growth will cause per capita disposable incomes to increase slightly in the near future. Consumer spending is also set to grow in the coming years, supporting revenue for the Hydroponic Crop Farming industry in the US.

industry_definition: Hydroponics is a method of growing plants using mineral nutrient solutions in water, without soil. Operators in this industry generally grow food crops under glass or protective cover.
key_trends: Vegetable prices have been on the rise since the pandemic, leading to higher revenue and average profit.
Hydroponics create stability for farms amid changing weather patterns, because hydroponic crops are grown in a controlled environment.
Farmers enjoy several tax breaks and allowable deductions, however, the total tax deduction for conservation expenses is limited to 25.0% of the gross farm income for a given year.
Vegetable prices determine farm revenue, and since the pandemic produce prices have been on the rise.
Tomatoes account for the greatest share of sales because tomatoes are easy to grow hydroponically and in high demand in the US.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment includes markets for fresh produce; supermarkets and other grocery stores are often the primary outlets for fresh produce, but food service-related industries also fall within this segment. This segment has shrunk as large supermarkets with more buying power negotiate better deals with farmers (rather than wholesalers).

This segment accounts for vegetables grown for processing, which are usually harvested mechanically and transported in bulk containers to processing plants. The increased popularity of premade salads and vegetable plates in supermarkets has grown this segment.

This segment accounts for other markets, including exports. Other markets include sales made directly to consumers. As the US dollar has appreciated, exports have slightly fallen over the past five years, decreasing the share of revenue from this market.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Tomatoes are one of the easiest crops to grow hydroponically because they require little space and have a relatively short growth cycle. Domestic demand for tomatoes and peppers is high throughout the year, so the market can't rely on the crop's seasonal outdoor growth cycle.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Greenhouses Protect Leafy Greens From Environmental Changes
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Lettuce, herbs and other leafy green vegetables are particularly vulnerable to environmental and pest damage. Lettuce grown in fields is often vulnerable to water contamination, which can lead to E.coli and other foodborne pathogens. Lettuce and herbs account for about a fifth of hydroponic produce sales.

international_trade_points.trade_description: While the US is a net exporter of agricultural goods, strong domestic demand contributes to it being a net importer of fruits and vegetables. A bulk of vegetable imports come from Mexico, where low labor costs allow inexpensive production.
Since vegetables are perishable and often consumed fresh, exports mostly go to Canada and Mexico. North American trade is facilitated by the USMCA, further boosting trade between the countries.

business_locations.location_description: The West region has ample space for hydroponic farms and a large population with strong demand.
Farms in the Southern states typically contract to processors. Growers in this region have access to readily available low-cost labor and growing conditions that are sufficient but not optimal.
Farms in this region typically contract to processors. Growers have access to readily available low-cost labor and growing conditions.

While vegetable farming occurs in nearly all US regions, the Rocky Mountains, Plains and Great Lakes regions are home to a sizeable number of hydroponic farms but lag behind the West, Southeast and Southwest regions.

regulations_points.regulation_title: MARKETING ORDERS BY THE US DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE
regulations_points.regulation_description: Marketing orders are designed and administered by handlers and growers' representatives and overseen by the US Department of Agriculture (USDA). They are designed to establish conditions such as enforcing product quality standards, regulating the flow of products to the market, standardizing packages and containers, creating reserve pools for storable commodities and authorizing production and marketing research and advertising.

Farmers wishing to promote their produce as organic must obtain certification from the USDA. The process requires a detailed description of the farming operation, history of substances applied to land over the previous three years and a written Organic System Plan describing the practices and substances to be used in future farming operations.
Most states operate agricultural departments that act as regulatory agencies. These authorities monitor pollution levels associated with growing fruit and nuts.

basis_points.basis_description: Production costs are a key competitive factor. Farmers with lower costs can invest in better machinery or technology to further improve efficiency.
Competition is growing as processed food production rises.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Three companies account for nearly all hydroponic sales
concentration_points.concentration_description: The Hydroponic Crop Farming industry has a high level of market share concentration because just three major companies own the largest greenhouses in the country.
Opening a competitive hydroponic farm requires significant capital investment, making it difficult for small companies to enter the industry.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Independent farms fill in small gaps in the industry
concentration_points.concentration_description: While the industry has a high level of market share concentration, most enterprises are small companies.
Traditional farms may have greenhouses, allowing them to generate a small amount of hydroponic crop-growing revenue.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases are a major cost for vegetable farmers, accounting for 29.2% of industry revenue in 2023.
Wages are expected to account for 24.8% of industry revenue in 2023.
